section.description:
To display the Create SQL Connection String dialog, click Add/Edit Saved Connections > New > Build.
First select the type of database you want to connect to in the Connection Type list. The options are:
section.note: In all cases described below you may enter the connection string directly into the Connection String field.

section.title: Access
section.description: If you selected "Access" for the Connection Type.

step.description: Optionally, click Create Database to create a new and empty database.
Otherwise:

case.description: Click the 'open folder' icon to navigate to and select a .MDB database file, then click Open.
If necessary, enter your login name in the User field.
Enter any additional parameters required by your database.
If the connection was successful, click OK to conclude.

section.title: Excel
section.description: If you selected "Excel" for the Connection Type.

step.description: Optionally, click Create Database to create a new and empty spreadsheet file.
Otherwise:

case.description: Click the 'open folder' icon to navigate to and select a .XLS file, then click Open.
If necessary, enter your login name in the User field.
Enter any additional parameters required by your spreadsheet.
If the connection was successful, click OK to conclude.

section.title: MySQL
section.description: If you selected "MySQL" for the Connection Type.

step.description: Enter the name of the server computer that contains the database in the Hostname field.
If necessary, change the port number.
Enter your login name in the User field.
Enter your password.
Click Tab to move to the Database field.
Optionally, select a database in the Database field.
Optionally, click Create Database to create a new and empty database.
Click Test Connection.
If the connection was successful, click OK to conclude.
